Label: Editor-B 12 second, Low-Energy Particles, Geotail - T. Mukai (ISAS)

DatasetLink.Title: ISAS DARTS
DatasetLink.Text: 3-sec MGF matnetic field data supplied by and also availble at

VariableDescription.Name: Ni
VariableDescription.LongDescription: Ion Density (Use only if no Editor-A data; qualitative use only if Energy Scan Code = 2 = RAM-B/SW)
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           Geotail Magnetic Field
#     PROJECT                         ISTP>International Solar-Terrestrial Physics
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     GEOTAIL>Geomagnetic tail
#     DATA_TYPE                       EDB12SEC>Editor-B 12 second (use Editor-A whenever available)
#     DESCRIPTOR                      LEP>Low-Energy Particles
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            Editor-A data are only acquired with the real-time operation in
#                                     Usuda Deep Space Center (UDSC),Japan, while the Editor-B data
#                                     are 24-hours continuously recorded in the onboard tape recorders
#                                     and are dumped over the NASA/JPL Deep Space Network (DSN) stations.
#                                     
#                                     Please use the Editor-A LEP dataset prior to the Editor-B LEP
#                                     dataset since plasma moments in the Editor-A data are more reliable.
#                                     (Plasma moments in the Editor-B are calculated onboard.)
#                                     
#                                     The ion energy analyzer (LEP-EAi) has two energy scan modes:
#                                     RAM-A (60eV to 40 keV) and RAM-B (5 keV to 40 keV).
#                                     The energy scan mode is automatically selected onboard depending
#                                     on the incoming ion fluxes. At present, only the plasma moments
#                                     in the RAM-A mode are plotted (listed) for the LEP-EAi data.
#                                     (The LEP-EAi moments are presented by the solid lines in the plot.)
#                                     
#                                     The plasma moment data of the solar wind analyzer (LEP-SW) should
#                                     be used only qualitatively. The LEP-SW plasma moments are plotted
#                                     (listed) when the energy scan mode of LEP-EAi is RAM-B.
#                                     (The LEP-SW moments are presented by the dotted lines in the plot.)
#                                     J.Geomag.Geoelectr.,46,669, 1994
#     MODS                            Created by R. McGuire on 9/1/2003; Adapted from GE_K0_MGF
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0087
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 ge_edb12sec_lep_19971206_v02
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  ge_edb12sec_lep
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Editor-B 12 second, Low-Energy Particles, Geotail
#     PI_NAME                         T. Mukai
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  ISAS
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Plasma and Solar Wind
#     LINK_TEXT                       3-sec MGF matnetic field data supplied by and also availble at
#     LINK_TITLE                      ISAS DARTS
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://www.darts.isas.ac.jp/stp/geotail/ascii.html
#     ALT_LOGICAL_SOURCE              Geotail_LEP_Ion-Moments-EditorB_12sec_cdf
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Geotail
#                                     !___Magnetospheric Data
#                                     !___Interplanetary Data near 1 AU
#     SPASE_DATASETRESOURCEID         spase://VMO/NumericalData/Geotail/LEP/EDB.PT12S
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Number of milliseconds since the epoch
#  2. Ion Density (Use only if no Editor-A data; qualitative use only if Energy Scan Code = 2 = RAM-B/SW)
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 17:42:09 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. Ion Density (Use only if no Editor-A data; qualitative use only if Energy Scan Code = 2 = RAM-B/SW)
#
EPOCH                                  ION_DENSITY_NI
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms  1/cc_(qual_only_if_scan=2=SW)
05-10-1993 00:00:34.460                     0.0150000

VariableDescription.Name: T
VariableDescription.LongDescription: Ion Temperature in Satellite coordinates (Use only if no Editor-A data; qualitative use only if Energy Scan Code = 2 = RAM-B/SW)
VariableDescription.Header:

#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******

#     TEXT                            Editor-A data are only acquired with the real-time operation in
#                                     Usuda Deep Space Center (UDSC),Japan, while the Editor-B data
#                                     are 24-hours continuously recorded in the onboard tape recorders
#                                     and are dumped over the NASA/JPL Deep Space Network (DSN) stations.

#                                     RAM-A (60eV to 40 keV) and RAM-B (5 keV to 40 keV).
#                                     The energy scan mode is automatically selected onboard depending
#                                     on the incoming ion fluxes. At present, only the plasma moments
#                                     in the RAM-A mode are plotted (listed) for the LEP-EAi data.
#                                     (The LEP-EAi moments are presented by the solid lines in the plot.)
#                                     
#                                     The plasma moment data of the solar wind analyzer (LEP-SW) should

#                                     (The LEP-SW moments are presented by the dotted lines in the plot.)

#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  ge_edb12sec_lep
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Editor-B 12 second, Low-Energy Particles, Geotail
#     PI_NAME                         T. Mukai
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  ISAS
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Plasma and Solar Wind
#     LINK_TEXT                       3-sec MGF matnetic field data supplied by and also availble at
#     LINK_TITLE                      ISAS DARTS
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://www.darts.isas.ac.jp/stp/geotail/ascii.html
#     ALT_LOGICAL_SOURCE              Geotail_LEP_Ion-Moments-EditorB_12sec_cdf
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Geotail
#                                     !___Magnetospheric Data
#                                     !___Interplanetary Data near 1 AU
#     SPASE_DATASETRESOURCEID         spase://VMO/NumericalData/Geotail/LEP/EDB.PT12S
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Number of milliseconds since the epoch
#  2. Ion Temperature in Satellite coordinates (Use only if no Editor-A data; qualitative use only if Energy Scan Code = 2 = RAM-B/SW)
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 17:42:10 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. Ion Temperature in Satellite coordinates (Use only if no Editor-A data; qualitative use only if Energy Scan Code = 2 = RAM-B/SW)
#
EPOCH                            ION_TEMP_TYY_(S/C)          ION_TEMP_TZZ_(S/C)
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms  eV_(qual_only_if_scan=2=SW) eV_(qual_only_if_scan=2=SW)
05-10-1993 00:00:34.460                           1                           1

VariableDescription.Name: Sensor
VariableDescription.Header:

VariableDescription.Name: scan_code
VariableDescription.LongDescription: Energy Scan Code (1 = Sensor Code EA = energy scan mode RAM-A, 2 = Sensor Code SW = energy scan mode RAM-B)
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           Geotail Magnetic Field
#     PROJECT                         ISTP>International Solar-Terrestrial Physics
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science

#     DESCRIPTOR                      LEP>Low-Energy Particles
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            Editor-A data are only acquired with the real-time operation in
#                                     Usuda Deep Space Center (UDSC),Japan, while the Editor-B data
#                                     are 24-hours continuously recorded in the onboard tape recorders
#                                     and are dumped over the NASA/JPL Deep Space Network (DSN) stations.
#                                     
#                                     Please use the Editor-A LEP dataset prior to the Editor-B LEP
#                                     dataset since plasma moments in the Editor-A data are more reliable.
#                                     (Plasma moments in the Editor-B are calculated onboard.)
#                                     
#                                     The ion energy analyzer (LEP-EAi) has two energy scan modes:
#                                     RAM-A (60eV to 40 keV) and RAM-B (5 keV to 40 keV).
#                                     The energy scan mode is automatically selected onboard depending
#                                     on the incoming ion fluxes. At present, only the plasma moments
#                                     in the RAM-A mode are plotted (listed) for the LEP-EAi data.
#                                     (The LEP-EAi moments are presented by the solid lines in the plot.)
#                                     
#                                     The plasma moment data of the solar wind analyzer (LEP-SW) should
#                                     be used only qualitatively. The LEP-SW plasma moments are plotted
#                                     (listed) when the energy scan mode of LEP-EAi is RAM-B.
#                                     (The LEP-SW moments are presented by the dotted lines in the plot.)

#     MODS                            Created by R. McGuire on 9/1/2003; Adapted from GE_K0_MGF
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0087
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 ge_edb12sec_lep_19971206_v02

#     LINK_TEXT                       3-sec MGF matnetic field data supplied by and also availble at

#     HTTP_LINK                       http://www.darts.isas.ac.jp/stp/geotail/ascii.html

# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 17:42:11 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. Energy Scan Code (1 = Sensor Code EA = energy scan mode RAM-A, 2 = Sensor Code SW = energy scan mode RAM-B)
#
EPOCH                          ENERGY_SCAN_CODE
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms  (1=EA=RAM-A,2=SW=RAM-B)
05-10-1993 00:00:34.460                       2

VariableDescription.Name: VGSE

VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           Geotail Magnetic Field
#     PROJECT                         ISTP>International Solar-Terrestrial Physics
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     GEOTAIL>Geomagnetic tail
#     DATA_TYPE                       EDB12SEC>Editor-B 12 second (use Editor-A whenever available)
#     DESCRIPTOR                      LEP>Low-Energy Particles
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            Editor-A data are only acquired with the real-time operation in
#                                     Usuda Deep Space Center (UDSC),Japan, while the Editor-B data
#                                     are 24-hours continuously recorded in the onboard tape recorders
#                                     and are dumped over the NASA/JPL Deep Space Network (DSN) stations.
#                                     
#                                     Please use the Editor-A LEP dataset prior to the Editor-B LEP
#                                     dataset since plasma moments in the Editor-A data are more reliable.
#                                     (Plasma moments in the Editor-B are calculated onboard.)
#                                     
#                                     The ion energy analyzer (LEP-EAi) has two energy scan modes:
#                                     RAM-A (60eV to 40 keV) and RAM-B (5 keV to 40 keV).
#                                     The energy scan mode is automatically selected onboard depending
#                                     on the incoming ion fluxes. At present, only the plasma moments
#                                     in the RAM-A mode are plotted (listed) for the LEP-EAi data.

#
EPOCH                                    ION_VX_(GSE)                  ION_VY_(GSE)                  ION_VZ_(GSE)
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms  km/s_(qual_only_if_scan=2=SW) km/s_(qual_only_if_scan=2=SW) km/s_(qual_only_if_scan=2=SW)

VariableDescription.Name: XYZGSM
VariableDescription.LongDescription: Geotail position in GSM cartesian coordinates
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           Geotail Magnetic Field
#     PROJECT                         ISTP>International Solar-Terrestrial Physics
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     GEOTAIL>Geomagnetic tail
#     DATA_TYPE                       EDB12SEC>Editor-B 12 second (use Editor-A whenever available)
#     DESCRIPTOR                      LEP>Low-Energy Particles
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            Editor-A data are only acquired with the real-time operation in
#                                     Usuda Deep Space Center (UDSC),Japan, while the Editor-B data
#                                     are 24-hours continuously recorded in the onboard tape recorders
#                                     and are dumped over the NASA/JPL Deep Space Network (DSN) stations.
#                                     
#                                     Please use the Editor-A LEP dataset prior to the Editor-B LEP
#                                     dataset since plasma moments in the Editor-A data are more reliable.
#                                     (Plasma moments in the Editor-B are calculated onboard.)
#                                     
#                                     The ion energy analyzer (LEP-EAi) has two energy scan modes:
#                                     RAM-A (60eV to 40 keV) and RAM-B (5 keV to 40 keV).
#                                     The energy scan mode is automatically selected onboard depending
#                                     on the incoming ion fluxes. At present, only the plasma moments
#                                     in the RAM-A mode are plotted (listed) for the LEP-EAi data.
#                                     (The LEP-EAi moments are presented by the solid lines in the plot.)
#                                     
#                                     The plasma moment data of the solar wind analyzer (LEP-SW) should
#                                     be used only qualitatively. The LEP-SW plasma moments are plotted
#                                     (listed) when the energy scan mode of LEP-EAi is RAM-B.
#                                     (The LEP-SW moments are presented by the dotted lines in the plot.)
#                                     J.Geomag.Geoelectr.,46,669, 1994
#     MODS                            Created by R. McGuire on 9/1/2003; Adapted from GE_K0_MGF
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0087
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 ge_edb12sec_lep_19971206_v02
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  ge_edb12sec_lep
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Editor-B 12 second, Low-Energy Particles, Geotail
#     PI_NAME                         T. Mukai
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  ISAS
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Plasma and Solar Wind
#     LINK_TEXT                       3-sec MGF matnetic field data supplied by and also availble at
#     LINK_TITLE                      ISAS DARTS
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://www.darts.isas.ac.jp/stp/geotail/ascii.html
#     ALT_LOGICAL_SOURCE              Geotail_LEP_Ion-Moments-EditorB_12sec_cdf
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Geotail
#                                     !___Magnetospheric Data
#                                     !___Interplanetary Data near 1 AU
#     SPASE_DATASETRESOURCEID         spase://VMO/NumericalData/Geotail/LEP/EDB.PT12S
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Number of milliseconds since the epoch
#  2. Geotail position in GSM cartesian coordinates
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 17:42:13 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. Geotail position in GSM cartesian coordinates
#
EPOCH                           GEOTAIL_X(GSM)         GEOTAIL_Y(GSM)         GEOTAIL_Z(GSM)
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms                      Re                     Re                     Re
05-10-1993 00:00:34.460               -122.230                23.9400                4.87000
